Cinavia workaround:
    Go to your sound settings
    Select audio output settings
    Switch from HDMI to optical digital (even if you use HDMI)
    Select every setting there is, then SAVE IT.
    Once its saved, it will take you back to sound settings, select audio multi-output and turn it ON.

anyway...overall i thought the movie was pretty decent. although at times predictable. 

good guy, a part of some kind of order/brotherhood what have you...saves mankind or country or city....the powers that be thank him and caste him and his companions aside never to be heard from again. 

until...low and behold their job wasn't as finished as they thought....they're called upon again to save us all...

explosions here...bodies there...forbidden love blah blah blah....

honestly...who didn't see any of this coming???

@CarlosSpicyweiner 

"a little dark in places. but that's to be expected from a theater. they intentionally run things darker"

This is R5 = Region 5 (old soviet), where movies often originate from and are distributed just as screeners, without the watermark on, and in near DVD quality. This is NOT a CAM!

PS3 & CINAVIA work around:

Â­audio will be 2 ch. Stereo ONLY. (surround not available)

1. Go to Sound Settings
2. Audio Settings
3. Select Optical Digital
4. Check all Boxes*
5. Save settings
6. Go to Audio Multi Output
7. Turn on and say OK

Make sure your Sound System works with the options.

*All you may need is the top 3 boxes checked.
